properties.description:
The Whole Enchilada

Rating: Black Diamond

Not for the faint of heart. This 34.1 Downhill epic starts in the high alpine of the La Sal mountains and meanders its way down into intense desert terrain, eventually bringing back into the warm embrace of Moab.

Dead Horse Point Tour

Rating: Blue Square

A mellow, but rewarding singletrack adventure that travels along the edge of the famous Dead Horse state park, giving riders an unbeatable view above Canyonlands National Park.

Big Mesa

Rating: Intermediate

A perfect trail for first timers in the desert. A fun ride through the red rock that offers a little bit of everything. Fun climbs, slick rock, and flowy descents.

Delicate Arch

Difficulty: Intermediate

The premier hike in Arches National Park. Delicate Arch might be a busy trail, but for good reason. Bring plenty of water, as this trail is most uphill to the main feature.

The West Rim Trail

An amazing 13 mile backpacking trail that begins in the high alpine and traverses back into Zion canyon.

Moab

The home of desert adventure in the southwest, Moab is a quirky town that offers a lot for visitors enjoying the many outdoor activities found in the area.

The Needles

The Needles is an off the beaten path section of Canyonlands National Park that offers some of the best day hiking and backpacking opportunities in the Moab area.

Ancient Art

Difficulty: 5.10 A0

The Stolen Chimney route up Ancient Art is one of the most famous and photographed climbs in the world. The climb leads to a small spire that only on person can stand on and get that selfie.

Indian Creek

Difficulty: various

The Indian Creek Rock Climbing area is a sandstone, crack climbing paradise, that features some of the most pristine desert towers in the world.
